data.comment: The match has started at Mercedes Benz Arena.
Orel Mangala puts the ball in the net and the home team now lead 1-0.
In the minute 1, Great play from Sasa Kalajdzic to set up the goal.
Free kick in a good position for Stuttgart!
Daniel Didavi hits the post! Very nearly a goal there for Stuttgart!
In the minute 3, Pascal Stenzel gets his shot on target but fails to score for Stuttgart.
1. FC Cologne awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Can Stuttgart get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in 1. FC Cologne's half?
In the minute 5, 1. FC Cologne awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in for Stuttgart in the half of 1. FC Cologne.
Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to Stuttgart in their own half.
In the minute 6, Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
Free kick for 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
Stuttgart awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 8, Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to Stuttgart in their own half.
Kingsley Ehizibue for 1. FC Cologne has been booked by Guido Winkmann and receives a first yellow card.
1. FC Cologne have a dangerous throw-in.
In the minute 11, 1. FC Cologne are coming forward and Kingsley Ehizibue gets in a strike, it misses the target, however.
Stuttgart have a goal kick.
Stuttgart to take a throw-in in 1. FC Cologne territory.
In the minute 15, A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
Stuttgart have been awarded a corner by Guido Winkmann.
Ball goes out of play for a 1. FC Cologne goal kick.
Free kick for Stuttgart in their own half.
In the minute 17, Markus Gisdol (1. FC Cologne) is making a first substitution, with Dimitris Limnios replacing Kingsley Ehizibue.
Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
In the minute 20, Corner awarded to 1. FC Cologne.
Play has been interrupted briefly in Stuttgart to check on Marc Kempf, who is grimacing with pain.
The match has been stopped briefly for attention to the injured Sebastiaan Bornauw.
In the minute 22, 1. FC Cologne have been given a penalty...
Sebastiaan Bornauw has recovered and rejoins the match in Stuttgart.
The match is now all square at 1-1 thanks to a penalty from Sebastian Andersson.
In the minute 24, 1. FC Cologne push forward at Mercedes Benz Arena and Ondrej Duda gets in a strike. This is blocked, however, by a determined Stuttgart defence.
Corner awarded to 1. FC Cologne.
Marc Kempf is back on the pitch.
In the minute 26, 1. FC Cologne have been awarded a corner by Guido Winkmann.
Guido Winkmann signals a 1. FC Cologne throw-in in Stuttgart's half.
Throw-in for Stuttgart at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 27, Guido Winkmann signals a 1. FC Cologne throw-in in Stuttgart's half.
Stuttgart to take a throw-in in 1. FC Cologne territory.
Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to Stuttgart.
In the minute 30, It's a goal kick for the away team in Stuttgart.
Stuttgart needs to be cautious. 1. FC Cologne have an attacking throw-in.
Important block from the Stuttgart defence as Ondrej Duda fires in a strike for 1. FC Cologne.
In the minute 32, Stuttgart awarded a free kick in their own half.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
Dimitris Limnios of 1. FC Cologne smashes in a shot on target. The keeper saves, though.
In the minute 33, Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne close to the penalty box.
Attention is being given to Stuttgartâ€™s Marc Kempf and play has been suspended briefly.
The home team has substituted Marc Kempf with Marcin Kaminski. Pellegrino Matarazzo is thus making his first change.
In the minute 35, Guido Winkmann awards the away team a throw-in.
Ball safe as 1. FC Cologne is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Throw-in Stuttgart.
In the minute 37, In Stuttgart a free kick has been awarded the away team.
Guido Winkmann awards Stuttgart a goal kick.
Throw-in high up the field for Stuttgart in Stuttgart.
In the minute 39, Free kick for 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
Throw-in 1. FC Cologne.
Throw-in for Stuttgart in the half of 1. FC Cologne.
In the minute 41, Can Stuttgart get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in 1. FC Cologne's half?
Stuttgart drive upfield and Gonzalo Castro gets in a shot. The strike is blocked by a 1. FC Cologne defender.
Can Stuttgart capitalize from this throw-in deep inside 1. FC Cologne's half?
In the minute 43, Goal kick for 1. FC Cologne at Mercedes Benz Arena.
Free kick for 1. FC Cologne in the half of Stuttgart.
1. FC Cologne's Ondrej Duda gets in a shot on goal at Mercedes Benz Arena. But the effort is unsuccessful.
In the minute 45, In Stuttgart Stuttgart drive forward through Tanguy Coulibaly. His shot is on target but it's saved.
Stuttgart have been awarded a corner by Guido Winkmann.
Wataru Endo (Stuttgart) goes close with a header but the ball is scrambled away by 1. FC Cologne defenders.
In the minute 45, 2 minutes will be added to the 1st half.
1. FC Cologne to take a throw-in in Stuttgart territory.
The first-half is over at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 46, The second-half is now underway.
Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne in the half of Stuttgart.
In Stuttgart 1. FC Cologne's Ismail Jakobs is caught offside.
In the minute 47, Orel Mangala of Stuttgart gets in a strike, but is off target.
Guido Winkmann awards 1. FC Cologne a goal kick.
Throw-in for Stuttgart in their own half.
Guido Winkmann awards the away team a throw-in.
In the minute 51, Silas Wamangituka is booked for the home team.
Corner awarded to 1. FC Cologne.
In the minute 53, 1. FC Cologne drives forward and Sebastian Andersson gets in a shot. Without netting, however.
Guido Winkmann signals a 1. FC Cologne throw-in in Stuttgart's half.
Ismail Jakobs's header is off-target for 1. FC Cologne.
In the minute 53, Ball goes out of play for a Stuttgart goal kick.
1. FC Cologne awarded a free kick in their own half.
Free kick Stuttgart.
In the minute 55, Ismail Jakobs (1. FC Cologne) gets a yellow card.
Stuttgart's Daniel Didavi misses with an attempt on goal.
1. FC Cologne have a goal kick.
In the minute 56, Nicolas Gonzalez is on a sub for Tanguy Coulibaly for Stuttgart.
Guido Winkmann signals a throw-in for Stuttgart, close to 1. FC Cologne's area.
The home team replace Silas Wamangituka with Roberto Massimo.
In the minute 58, Ball safe as 1. FC Cologne is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Can Stuttgart get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in 1. FC Cologne's half?
1. FC Cologne awarded a throw-in in their own half.
In the minute 60, It's a goal kick for the home team in Stuttgart.
1. FC Cologne's Elvis Rexhbecaj breaks free at Mercedes Benz Arena. But the strike goes wide of the post.
Goal kick for Stuttgart at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 61, Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne at Mercedes Benz Arena.
Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne at Mercedes Benz Arena.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
In the minute 66, Guido Winkmann signals a throw-in for 1. FC Cologne, close to Stuttgart's area.
Guido Winkmann waits before resuming play because Jannes Horn for 1. FC Cologne is still down.
1. FC Cologneâ€™s Jannes Horn is on his feet again at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 68, Ball goes out of play for a Stuttgart goal kick.
Free kick for Stuttgart in their own half.
Ondrej Duda (1. FC Cologne) has received a yellow card from Guido Winkmann.
In the minute 69, In Stuttgart a free kick has been awarded the home team.
It's a goal kick for the away team in Stuttgart.
In the minute 70, Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to 1. FC Cologne.
1. FC Cologne make their second substitution with Anthony Modeste replacing Sebastian Andersson.
Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to Stuttgart in their own half.
Free kick Stuttgart.
Wataru Endo (Stuttgart) wins the ball in the air but heads wide.
Goal kick for 1. FC Cologne at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 72, 1. FC Cologne's Ellyes Skhiri has been booked in Stuttgart.
In the minute 74, Stuttgart are pushing forward but Nicolas Gonzalez's finish is wide of the goal.
Guido Winkmann awards 1. FC Cologne a goal kick.
Darko Churlinov is replacing Sasa Kalajdzic for Stuttgart at Mercedes Benz Arena.
In the minute 74, Pellegrino Matarazzo is making the team's fifth substitution at Mercedes Benz Arena with Philipp Klement replacing Daniel Didavi.
1. FC Cologne's Ondrej Duda attacks the ball with his head but his effort fails to hit the target.
Stuttgart have a goal kick.
In the minute 77, Corner awarded to Stuttgart.
Throw-in for Stuttgart in the half of 1. FC Cologne.
Stuttgart to take a throw-in in 1. FC Cologne territory.
In the minute 78, Stuttgart's Darko Churlinov is whistled for offside at Mercedes Benz Arena.
Guido Winkmann signals a Stuttgart throw-in in 1. FC Cologne's half.
Throw-in 1. FC Cologne.
In the minute 79, 1. FC Cologne awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Stuttgart will need to be alert as they defend a dangerous free kick from 1. FC Cologne.
At Mercedes Benz Arena, Atakan Karazor has been yellow-carded for the home team.
In the minute 81, Jannes Horn (1. FC Cologne) does not seem to be able to continue. He is replaced by Noah Katterbach.
The away team have replaced Ondrej Duda with Salih Ozcan. This is the fourth substitution made today by Markus Gisdol.
Guido Winkmann awards the away team a throw-in.
In the minute 84, Throw-in for 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
Free kick for Stuttgart in the half of 1. FC Cologne.
1. FC Cologne have a goal kick.
In the minute 85, Guido Winkmann signals a free kick to 1. FC Cologne in their own half.
Salih Ozcan for 1. FC Cologne gets in a strike but fails to hit the target.
Ball goes out of play for a Stuttgart goal kick.
In the minute 86, A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
In Stuttgart 1. FC Cologne attack through Ismail Jakobs. The finish is off target, however.
It's a goal kick for the home team in Stuttgart.
In the minute 88, Salih Ozcan (1. FC Cologne) has received a yellow card from Guido Winkmann.
Can Stuttgart get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in 1. FC Cologne's half?
In the minute 89, Marius Wolf returns to the field for 1. FC Cologne after picking up a slight injury.
The match at Mercedes Benz Arena has been interrupted briefly for a check on Marius Wolf, who is down injured.
At Mercedes Benz Arena the fourth official shows that 3 minutes will be added to the 2nd half.
1. FC Cologne have been awarded a corner by Guido Winkmann.
Rafael Czichos (1. FC Cologne) gets up for a header but cannot keep the ball on target.
Goal kick for Stuttgart at Mercedes Benz Arena.
Guido Winkmann awards 1. FC Cologne a goal kick.
A throw-in for the away team on the opposite half.
The second-half is over. The match ends 1-1.
